festivals.name: Sinulog Festival
festivals.description: Sinulog Festival is a well-known festival in Cebu held every third Sunday of January to honor the Sto. Ni√±o (Child Jesus) and commemorates the acceptance of Christianity by the Cebuanos. The festival features a grand parade with colorful costumes, street dancing, and loud drumbeats.

festivals.name: Kadaugan sa Mactan
festivals.description: Held every April 27, this festival commemorates the victory of Lapu-Lapu, a native chieftain, over Portuguese explorer Ferdinand Magellan in the Battle of Mactan in 1521.

festivals.name: Pintos Festival
festivals.description: Celebrated every third week of October in Bogo City, Cebu, this festival showcases the city's agricultural heritage. The festival features colorful street dances and parades where participants wear costumes made of rice stalks and other agricultural products.

festivals.name: Halad Inasal Festival
festivals.description: Held every October in Talisay City, this festival is a celebration of the city's famous dish, inasal (grilled chicken). The festival features a grand street parade, food fair, and cultural shows.

festivals.name: Cebu City Charter Day
festivals.description: Held every February 24, this festival commemorates the founding of Cebu City in 1565. The festival features a grand parade, street dancing, and cultural shows.
